DOC.brief_summary: This research trial study skin/soft tissue elasticity head neck cancer survivor lymphedema fibrosis . Lymphedema fibrosis common effect head neck cancer may lead skin tightness , pain , body image issue . Early detection lymphedema fibrosis may help reduce serious functional loss neck . Shear wave elastography technique provide quantitative measure stiffness use push pulse generate shear wave within tissue . Conventional image technique use monitor shear wave generate tissue calculate shear wave speed . Shear wave elastography may help obtain early accurate measurement tissue elasticity head neck cancer survivor .
DOC.brief_title: Skin/Soft Tissue Elasticity Head Neck Cancer Survivors With Lymphedema Fibrosis
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To obtain pilot data elasticity skin/soft tissue use shear wave elasticity define anatomical site head neck cancer survivor lymphedema fibrosis ( LEF ) . II . To explore correlation elasticity skin/soft tissue follow : 1 ) symptom measure Lymphedema Symptom Intensity Distress Survey-Head Neck ( LSIDS-HN ) ; 2 ) functional impact measure Cervical Range Motion Device Vanderbilt Head Neck Symptom Survey ; 3 ) physical exam finding measure Head Neck LEF Grading Criteria . OUTLINE : Participants evaluate LEF status use Head Neck External Lymphedema - Fibrosis ( HN-LEF ) Grading Criteria neck range motion use Cervical Range Motion Device . Participants also complete study questionnaire , include Vanderbilt Head Neck Symptom Survey ( VHNSS ) Lymphedema Symptom Intensity Distress Survey - Head Neck ( LSIDS-H & N ) . Participants undergo ultrasound shear wave elastography 20-25 minute . Participants ' cancer disease treatment information gather medical record .
DOC.criteria: Histologically confirm cancer involve head neck Completed therapy No evidence cancer ( NED ) Ability understand English order complete questionnaire Able provide inform consent Have medical record documentation significant cognitive impairment would preclude ability provide inform consent Are unwilling undergo study assessment Have recurrent and/or metastatic cancer
